required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: AS OCT Evaluation for Perforated Punctual Plugs
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Implanted Perforated Lacrimal Punctal Plugs Using Anterior Segment Optical Coherence Tomography.

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of the perforated punctal plugs after implantation in cases of punctal stenosis regarding position and patency in the early postoperative period (during the first operative weak)

detailed_description.textblock:
Prospective non randomized case series study included 50 eyes. The study is conducted on patients attending to the oculoplastic unit of ophthalmology department of Minia university hospital. Informed consents were obtained from the participants in this study. The study was adherent to the tenets of declaration of Heleniski.
Anterior segment optical coherence tomography(AS-OCT) was performed for the included patients after perforated plug implantation (during the first operative weak)

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the fitting of implanted perforated lacrimal plugs
primary_outcome.description: Either plug is in place or rotated

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the patency of the plugs
primary_outcome.description: Either plug is patent or occluded

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation any contents within the plugs
Evaluation of the lower tear film height
primary_outcome.description: measuring the tear film meniscus height at the lower lid margin (at the centre of the inferior limbus), height is measured in micrometers

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the tear level within the plug
primary_outcome.description: Either within the lower half or upper half of the plug

intervention.description: Examination of the implanted perforated lacrimal plugs using anterior segment optical coherent tomography

study_pop.textblock: Patients with epiphora will be evaluated to exclude other causes than punctal stenosis. Perforated punctal plugs were implanted under topical anaesthesia. patients follow up and AS-OCT

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with punctal stenosis who will be treated by implantation of perorated punctal plugs
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are not willing to participate in the study

facility.name: Ophthalmology department/ Minia University Hospital/Minia University
